paper_metadata.title: Germline DNA-Repair Genes and HOXB13 Mutations in Korean Men with Metastatic Prostate Cancer: Data from a Large Korean Cohort
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Korean men with metastatic prostate cancer

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 variants were most commonly observed in the cohort, indicating a significant role in metastatic prostate cancer.

variants.additional_notes: BRCA2 was the most frequently mutated gene in the study.
key_quotes: BRCA2 was the most frequently mutated gene common to different cohorts supporting its importance.
BRCA2 mutation was significantly more likely to be present in Korean mPC compared to healthy counterparts (OR 11.37, p<0.001).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
